Consent to join the Developer Health Research Study.
Now you will create a passcode to identify yourself to the app and protect access to information you've entered.
This step concludes the onboarding and consent process for the study. Next up, you will see main app functionality.
Please try again in five minutes.

Use this text to provide an explanation to your app participants about what activity data you intend to read from the Health app and why. This sample will read step count, distance, heart rate, and flights climbed data.

Use this text to provide an explanation to your app participants about what electronic health records (EHR) you intend to collect from the Health app and why. This sample will read all available records (for which permission is granted).
Sign in using your Apple ID is fast and easy, and Apple will not track any of your activities.
We need to confirm your email address and send you a copy of the consent you just signed.
Are you sure you want to withdraw?
Withdrawing from the study will reset the app to the state it was in prior to you originally joining the study.
Thank you for your contribution to this study. We are sorry that you could not continue. The app will now close.

You are invited to participate in Digital Professional Development (‚ÄúDigital-PD‚Äù), a Stanford University study on designing efficient professional development activities. Over the course of each workday, you will be asked to complete a series of additional activities designed to resemble tasks which would ordinarily be part of your workflow. Additionally, you will be asked to complete questionnaires asking opinions of the training exercises at various times throughout the day. You will be asked to wear a device on your wrist to monitor physiological activity during the training exercises, and this application will be used to track where and when you choose to complete your professional development exercises.

You are invited to participate in Digital Professional Development (‚ÄúDigital-PD‚Äù), a Stanford University study on designing efficient professional development activities. Over the course of each workday, you will be asked to complete a series of additional activities designed to resemble tasks which would ordinarily be part of your workflow. Additionally, you will be asked to complete questionnaires asking opinions of the training exercises at various times throughout the day. You will be asked to wear a device on your wrist to monitor physiological activity during the training exercises, and this application will be used to track where and when you choose to complete your professional development exercises.

Your participation in this program is entirely voluntary. You can decide to participate now, and withdraw your consent later and stop being in the program without any loss of benefits or compensation. This study will be administered at your place of work, and your primary interactions with the study will take place through this mobile platform. Your participation in the program will last for a period of 90 days.

Your participation in this program is entirely voluntary. You can decide to participate now, and withdraw your consent later and stop being in the program without any loss of benefits or compensation. This study will be administered at your place of work, and your primary interactions with the study will take place through this mobile platform. Your participation in the program will last for a period of 90 days.

As we are collecting biometric data, we take privacy and confidentiality seriously. Health information will be anonymized and presented to researchers in a de-identified fashion. The biometric data we collect will be stored on a secure HIPAA compliant server and the Stanford HCI Lab will follow HIPAA guidelines whenever interacting with the data. Data from this program may be presented at scientific meetings or published in scientific journals. Your identity and/or your personal health information will not be disclosed except as authorized by you or as required by law. However, there is always some risk that even de-identified information might be re-identified. Data collected from or about you as part of theDigital-PD that can directly identify you (including your name and address) is called ‚ÄúProtected Personal Information.‚Äù Your Protected Personal Information will be held confidential by the staff and access limited to those who need access in order to administer and conduct the program activities (eg., if the core research team needs to contact you during the study).
Your remaining data will be separated from your Protected Personal Information and will be assigned a key code (we call this ‚ÄúCoded Study Data‚Äù). Information about the Coded Data will be kept in a secure location and access will be limited as described in this consent.
Finally, aggregated, non-identifiable data, may be reviewed for quality assurance and to evaluate effectiveness of the program.

As we are collecting biometric data, we take privacy and confidentiality seriously. Health information will be anonymized and presented to researchers in a de-identified fashion. The biometric data we collect will be stored on a secure HIPAA compliant server and the Stanford HCI Lab will follow HIPAA guidelines whenever interacting with the data. Data from this program may be presented at scientific meetings or published in scientific journals. Your identity and/or your personal health information will not be disclosed except as authorized by you or as required by law. However, there is always some risk that even de-identified information might be re-identified. Data collected from or about you as part of theDigital-PD that can directly identify you (including your name and address) is called ‚ÄúProtected Personal Information.‚Äù Your Protected Personal Information will be held confidential by the staff and access limited to those who need access in order to administer and conduct the program activities (eg., if the core research team needs to contact you during the study).
Your remaining data will be separated from your Protected Personal Information and will be assigned a key code (we call this ‚ÄúCoded Study Data‚Äù). Information about the Coded Data will be kept in a secure location and access will be limited as described in this consent.
Finally, aggregated, non-identifiable data, may be reviewed for quality assurance and to evaluate effectiveness of the program.

Your contact information (e.g. name, email address, phone number and zip code) and demographic information (e.g. age, gender, height, and weight) will be collected upon the start of the program.
Additional data may be collected via Apple‚Äôs Health Kit from your smartphone and/or connected wearables such as a smartwatch with your permission:
‚Ä¢ Sensor information (e.g. accelerometer, gyroscope, heart rate) ‚Ä¢ Device metadata (e.g. Timezone, device operating system version, on/off wrist status) ‚Ä¢ Activity (e.g step count, distance walking/running, stride length, passive 6MWT, distance cycling, wheelchair push count, distance wheelchair, swimming stroke count, distance swimming, distance downhill snow sports, basal energy burned, active energy burned, flights climbed, Nike fuel, Apple exercise time, Apple stand time, Apple stand hours) ‚Ä¢ Body Measures (e.g. height, weight, BMI, lean body mass, body fat percentage, waist circumference) ‚Ä¢ Vital Signs (e.g. heart rate, low or high HR event, irregular heart rate event, resting HR, HR variability, walking HR, heartbeat series, oxygen saturation, body temperature, blood pressure, respiratory rate, VO2 max) ‚Ä¢ Nutrition (e.g. identifiers regarding diet, water intake) ‚Ä¢ Mindfulness & Sleep (e.g. mindful session, sleep analysis) ‚Ä¢ Audio Exposure (e.g. audio exposure event, environmental audio exposure, headphone audio exposure) ‚Ä¢ UV Exposure ‚Ä¢ Self-Care (e.g. toothbrushing) ‚Ä¢ Workout type identifier, workout route identifier ‚Ä¢ Apple Health Clinical Records (e.g. clinical visits, blood pressure, lab tests, medications, procedures, immunizations, conditions)
If available we may query these data from a timepoint prior to your onboarding to help establish baseline metrics.

Your contact information (e.g. name, email address, phone number and zip code) and demographic information (e.g. age, gender, height, and weight) will be collected upon the start of the program.
Additional data may be collected via Apple‚Äôs Health Kit from your smartphone and/or connected wearables such as a smartwatch with your permission:
‚Ä¢ Sensor information (e.g. accelerometer, gyroscope, heart rate) ‚Ä¢ Device metadata (e.g. Timezone, device operating system version, on/off wrist status) ‚Ä¢ Activity (e.g step count, distance walking/running, stride length, passive 6MWT, distance cycling, wheelchair push count, distance wheelchair, swimming stroke count, distance swimming, distance downhill snow sports, basal energy burned, active energy burned, flights climbed, Nike fuel, Apple exercise time, Apple stand time, Apple stand hours) ‚Ä¢ Body Measures (e.g. height, weight, BMI, lean body mass, body fat percentage, waist circumference) ‚Ä¢ Vital Signs (e.g. heart rate, low or high HR event, irregular heart rate event, resting HR, HR variability, walking HR, heartbeat series, oxygen saturation, body temperature, blood pressure, respiratory rate, VO2 max) ‚Ä¢ Nutrition (e.g. identifiers regarding diet, water intake) ‚Ä¢ Mindfulness & Sleep (e.g. mindful session, sleep analysis) ‚Ä¢ Audio Exposure (e.g. audio exposure event, environmental audio exposure, headphone audio exposure) ‚Ä¢ UV Exposure ‚Ä¢ Self-Care (e.g. toothbrushing) ‚Ä¢ Workout type identifier, workout route identifier ‚Ä¢ Apple Health Clinical Records (e.g. clinical visits, blood pressure, lab tests, medications, procedures, immunizations, conditions)
If available we may query these data from a timepoint prior to your onboarding to help establish baseline metrics.

We anticipate this program to contain minimal risks to the participants. This program involves the following additional risks, and possible inconveniences: Your health information related to this program may be used or disclosed in connection with this program, including, but not limited to name, email, gender, ethnicity, and previous medical and surgical treatments as described in the Confidentiality section above. Although we will take steps to maintain the confidentiality of your Study Data, complete confidentiality cannot be assured. By law, we are obligated to report any data breach.

We anticipate this program to contain minimal risks to the participants. Although we will take steps to maintain the confidentiality of your Study Data, complete confidentiality cannot be assured. By law, we are obligated to report any data breach.
You will be financially compensated for your participation in this study.
You will be financially compensated for your participation in this study.

You should not feel obligated to agree to participate. Your questions should be answered clearly and to your satisfaction.
You will be told of any important new information that is learned during the course of this program, which might affect your condition or your willingness to continue participation in this program.
You have the right to refuse to answer particular questions.

You should not feel obligated to agree to participate. Your questions should be answered clearly and to your satisfaction.
You will be told of any important new information that is learned during the course of this program, which might affect your condition or your willingness to continue participation in this program.
You have the right to refuse to answer particular questions.

Any questions about the Digital-PD study are welcome. If you have any doubts or questions, please ask us for further explanation. Our contact information is Email: coopermj@stanford.edu Phone number: 555-555-5555
